description: Buy the Wahoo Fitness KICKR Rollr online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: KICKR Rollr
hasVariant.description: Buy the Wahoo Fitness KICKR Rollr online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this trainer to supplement my weekly mileage. I didn’t want the hassle of a direct drive trainer….I wanted something easy to install and remove, and I wanted realistic movement as static trainers often, well let’s just say make me numb in my nether regions🙂. So far the Rollr has met both criteria. It is very smooth and allows me to work on cadence and do “intervals”. I haven’t tried to do “hill work” yet, but may get to that later. I have not used it with Zwift or other on line services…I don’t want to pay $17/mo for subscription and my focus is not on indoor training—I want to get outside as much as I can. The Rollr allows me to easily switch to indoors when the rain comes, or I want to get my “ride” in before the sun comes up. Finally, I do have Garmin pedals for the power meter. More to follow as I use it more.
review.name: Great indoor trainer to add “miles”

review.reviewBody:
The Rollr is what everyone says it is. It comes in 2 pieces and takes no time to put together. It is extremely well made, solid, and a joy to use. Putting the bike on and taking it off takes no time. Not having to take the rear wheel off, deal with a messy chain, get grease on your hands (and then repeating all that to ride the bike off the trainer) are truly great. I can use my road bike (not some poor alternative bike) to train on and to ride. It also connected to my Garmin power meters right away, and to both Rouvy and Zwift with no issues. I let cadence and power go through the Rollr and only connected my heartrate monitor to the workout apps.
One setup matter to be aware of that takes more than 10 seconds is lining up the rollers and the front wheel well so that the tires sit evenly in both locations, with full contact. This takes some fiddling around, but once set, it’s done.
The one issue to be wary of is also why I gave it 4 stars. It’s really not the fault of the Rollr, but rollers create more natural resistance than hooking a chain to a flywheel does on other trainers. The result is that there is no easy coasting here. You’re at around120 power just  riding on flat terrain on a low gear. So it’s always a real workout on the Rollr.
review.name: Great, but also beware

name: KICKR Rollr

review.reviewBody:
The toe box is amazing.  Sensitive with a dash of edging support.  Great for gym climbing and overhanging rock.  The heel is very disappointing.  It is both baggy and soft and doesn't seem to work with real rock at all (its fine indoors.) Recommend the Furia S or Drago over this shoe if you climb outdoors.

Sizing is probably 1 -> 1.5 euro size down from your regular scarpa size.  My street shoe is 44 euro (10 -> 10.5).  I have the instinct vsw and furia s in 43 and got these in a 42.  41.5 would have been a better size
review.name: Great toe, terrible heel

review.reviewBody: I’m a loyal La Sportiva girl. My favorite shoes are the ladies’ Kataki. They are an excellent all rounder for indoors and outdoors and at my skill level (intermediate) I rarely need anything more aggressive. I value comfort.  But when i started pandemic moonboarding, I found the kataki too stiff. I ordered the Scarpa Furia Air on a friend’s recommendation, and I love them on the moonboard. Very precise, sensitive, comfortable. The comfort was a surprise given their aggressive profile and tiny sizing. I initially purchased my La Sportiva size (37) but they were waaaaaaay too small. I sized up to 37.5 and I was worried they were still too small-they are a good half inch shorter than my Katakis and more narrow (see photo). They hurt to sit around in and my toes are pretty much bent in half, but as soon as I get on the wall they feel perfect! Glad i didn’t size up more than half a size.
review.name: Surprisingly comfy; great performance

name: Furia Air Climbing Shoe
Furia Air Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: I have always loved SB jumpsuits but absolutely hate this one. It’s heavy and definitely not sweat wicking. Unless you are doing yin in Finland, it will feel heavy and wet after practice. It’s a bobble magnet so although new, doesn’t look it after first use. And finally, the worse, the very annoying little fiddly button at the neck. “What  I really need is a small, fiddly, pointless little button  that does nothing for fuction but makes it a hassle to use the toilet or get changed” said no one ever. This is a total miss for me and I have something like 7 previous jumpsuits from SB.
review.name: A complete disappointment

review.reviewBody: I love the jumpsuit. it is really confortable and it feels lovely in the body. I think it is big for its size.

review.reviewBody: Really like the idea of this jumpsuit it fits great and ideal for after gym session but the fastener on the back doesn’t work it keeps coming undone, very annoying
review.name: Nice fit but the fastener at the back doesn’t work

review.reviewBody: I am 173cm and 56kg, C cup, bought size S. I have previous versions of the jumpsuit so bought straight away in two colors and if I was not abroad when I was still able to return it, I definitely would. Sizing about right, leg length is good and not seemingly too short. Sweaty Betty kept the shape from the long arm version (which is more bat-wing like) and the top is super baggy as a result. Honestly, am wearing this only out for dog walks into the fields near by and house work. Bit too expensive, but hey, my fault... Positives, the fabric is good quality and it is comfortable.
review.name: Way too baggy top

review.reviewBody: Reply great all rounder for travel and leisure . Lovely country may buttery fabric and so comfy . Only small but annoying  negative is the tiny button and loop at the neck which is a pain every time you go to the loo ! I’ve worn this travelling and on days out on holidays . Love it
review.name: All rounder
comment: I agree with you about the button at the back. Otherwise I love this jump suite.

review.reviewBody: Lovely jumpsuit, comfortable and fit for purpose on the whole. However, like many reviews - after one wear the button at the back comes comtinually loose as the elastic button hole has not been sewn down properly. For the price, quality issues like this are really annyoing and shouldn't be happening.
review.name: Good but quality issues

review.reviewBody: Really love the gaia jumpsuits also have the long sleeve. Good fit and comfortable for workouts or casual wesr. Only small negative with the sleeveless is that i found it didn't stay done up at the back. Button to small forthe loop.an easy fix but annoying given the price
review.name: Great jumpsuit

review.reviewBody: Good quality jumpsuit. Very flattering. True to size. Nice touch at the back with the button fastening making it more stylish than the previous design, however, the elastic fastener is too small for the button & keeps slipping off; i’m going to have to find a way of fixing it. That’s the only reason i’m giving it a 4 star instead of 5.
review.name: Versatile jumpsuit, dress it up or down

name: Gaia Yoga Jumpsuit - Women's

review.reviewBody: These sneakers fit perfectly, the trick is finding the right size. 7.5 US/38 in Dansko but 38.5 in La Sportiva. They are so comfortable I don’t want to take them off after returning home. Just right arch support. Thanks, Backcountry, for competitive pricing!
review.name: Great sneakers!

review.reviewBody:
I have narrow feet, not super narrow, but narrow enough that shoes and sandals w/out laces or a means of tightening slide off. I wear Amalfi Ragone N and Munro N or M.

In the past, I wore Bushidos, but this time around the toebox just felt like it was squashing my toes. (I have bunions and have been working to spread by toes out more). The Karacals are perfect. My feet can splay out in the toebox, but the shoe holds my foot from sliding around.

I actually had to call La Sportiva in CO to figure out which model would be the best for me. And they were very helpful and right on.

I use the shoes for general recreational walking, on paths or over uneven terrain - not hiking or running (because I can't), but I can see how they would hold me from slipping if I were to do those activities.

I also like how the heel has more cushion than in the front, so my toes can kind of grip the ground better.

The breathability of the canvas is also nice, especially in the toe area. I've used them in mid 30s-mid 50s weather so far.

The only thing to watch out for is to order a size or half a size up. Depending on whether you use the European or the American system, the amount up will vary.

In Pikolinos I wear 39, in Amalfi Rangone 8N, in Munro 8-8.5 N-M, Onitsuka Tiger 39.5 or 6.5US (men), and in these, Karacal, 40 or 8.5US.
review.name: Wide Toe Box but Holds Narrow Feet

review.reviewBody: I’m more of a hiker than a trail runner, but I wanted grippy shoes for a hike that required a lot of boulder scrambling, and I prefer a sneaker over a boot. I was concerned when I read on a shoe review website that the neck was a little high and it was rated 7 in terms of comfort, but I think this is an awesome shoe. They didn’t need any breaking in. I took them on a short urban 3 mile hike before doing a 12.2 mile hike two days later with a 3,900 ft elevation gain. They were so comfortable and had awesome grip. I have medium wide feet and normally wear a US 6.5 Adidas, 7.0 Nike, and I got these in 7.0.
review.name: Awesome shoe

name: Karacal Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: After a month, we can truly say that we have put this cooler through a very thorough testing and are delighted.
review.name: Well-made cooler that doesn't need ice!

review.reviewBody:
I've had the everfrost 30 for a few weeks now and used it a lot over the last 7 days. I have to say that I am impressed. It kept all my food and drinks cold. I will never have to worry about getting ice again and I love that. The build quality is great. The ability to charge via AC, DC or Solar makes charging convenient. Getting it cold doesn't take long. Since there is no ice, there is a lot of space for food and drink. It was 90+ at the race track this past weekend and it kept everything cold. Now the cons. It's heavy. When full I don't find it any heavier than my typical coolers with ice but it's still heavy when empty. It's big. I can't get it in my trunk from the back but have to slide it in through the back seat. Not the end of the world and worth the hassle but still not great. The battery won't last the 2 days that the website says it will. I'd get about a day and a half. Stiff good but not what is reported. They must have set it up and not open the door for 2 days. 

Overall though... I would recommend. Especially when it is on sale.
review.name: I'm happy and impressed.

review.reviewBody: Love the new fridge. The temp inside is within 2-3 degrees of the programmed temp. Cool looking and quiet.
review.name: New Anker

review.reviewBody:
So far, so good. The cooler just arrived, and the shipping was pretty fast. I set it up in the family room and put a thermometer inside to test for temperatures. I ran it overnight on wall outlet power and it maintained the 40 degrees I had set it at, and it also fully charged the battery. Next, I disconnected the wall power to see how it runs on the battery. It immediately switched to battery power. I let it run on battery power for over 24 hours. It continued to maintain the temperature setting, and after the 24 hours the battery was at around 40%.

Next, I need to test it in my 4Runner running off of the 12-volt car power. This is the primary reason I purchased this, is for road trips. 

The only thing I was a little disconcerted about was the temperature readout on the unit fluctuated a bit more around my set temperature than I expected from reading the manual and online FAQs, going down to about 32 and then back up to around 40 where I had it set. The online FAQ indicated a ±2° cycle around the set point without indicating units (Celsius or Fahrenheit). I suspect their FAQ used Celsius which would explain why the fluctuations in Fahrenheit would be larger. In any case, I don't think this is a big deal; they just might want to clarify the temperature units in their online article on the topic.
review.name: First Ever Electric Cooler

review.reviewBody: Such a great investment. Used with the Anker Solar panel and I get to keep things cool all from the sun!
review.name: Such a great investment. Used

review.reviewBody: This cooler is on the correct path for me battery did not hold up as advertised. Compressor runs for awhile stops. 12v outlet too stiff pushes out of the socket. If your not careful easy to flip switch turn it off.
review.name: Wanted to love it.

review.reviewBody: I recently took this out for its first spin, and it was the perfect cooler to have on a road trip! It kept the food and drinks at a crisp temperature all day long while sitting in the car, with 30-something percent battery left at the end of the day. Highly recommend!
review.name: Excellent investment

review.reviewBody: This unit is perfect! We no longer have to worry about melting ice and the mess it causes. We have more room for food which is great. Strongly recommend these units, you will not be disappointed!
review.name: Long overdue!

review.reviewBody: Will be using this for cross-country road trips. Tested at home plugged in as well as on the battery. Keeping things nearly ice cold (that's where I set it) for 2-3 days on battery alone. Really happy with this. Game changer!
review.name: Wow! Very impressed!

review.reviewBody: Great little portable fridge. It performs exactly as advertised. No Complaints.
review.name: Great little portable fridge. It

name: Everfrost Powered Cooler

review.reviewBody: The upfront cost for this trailer is pricey, but it will save you money long term from not buying gas and grocery bags! I’ve been using the Burley Travoy trailer with my ebike and it completely replaced my car for grocery runs. With it, I can forgo using the shopping cart and have all my groceries safely packed away while shopping. No more forgetting my shopping bags because the Burley market bags can be attached to the trailer. Halls the heaviest load. Comes with secure pockets for smaller items. Packs away neatly into a smaller size when not in use. Say goodbye to expensive gas: car dependency is a thing of the past! My health significantly improved as the convenience of this trailer gives me the incentive to use my ebike more for traveling. Try it, you might like it!
review.name: No more car dependency!

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased a Travoy to use as a cart for Plein Air painting. Several of my friends have them and we find them very convenient to tote all our materials easily over even the roughest terrain. I think you should consider advertising in Plein Air magazine. Lots of painters struggle with all the gear we take on location. As an older artist I appreciate the portability and ease of loading, unloading, and mostly the smoothness that the large tires provide.
review.name: Best purchase!!!

review.reviewBody: Highly recommended, super high quality that I am happy to pay for. I got the lower bag as well, afterwards. They function just perfectly on the Travoy, and off as well. Design/style/construct, they got everything right. Sturdy substantial, still very lightweight. (And in general, anywhere around my house, look cool too). Also, I like the effective and easy attach to Travoy frame.
review.name: Carry easy

review.reviewBody: Great bag. Works well for groceries and other stuff.
review.name: Great bag!

review.reviewBody: Lost my Travoy of 7 years, bought new one including this Upper Market Bag. This new bag version is SUCH an improvement over the original. Custom hidden flap catches, fold-flat, more robust mesh, front phone pocket, pair of shopping-bag-style handles on either side, rear light fixing point, bigger/better rear pocket. It's amazing - had been a intelligent feature choice, extremely well designed, robustly engineered new version. A huge pity that it's not available in New Zealand (come on guys, please)
review.name: Excellent, amazing design

review.reviewBody: Finally used today & really like it. I was able to fit more groceries on the Burley & like the extra pockets for coin purse, phone etc.
review.name: Upper market bag

review.reviewBody: The upper market bag is just what I need for my travoy. It is well made & a great size.
review.name: Great bag!

name: Upper Market Bag

hasVariant.description: Buy the The North Face Cobra 65L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I usually doing alpine mountaineering, did a climb Mt Hood with this backpack , for 1 day probably you need another cobra 38 litre, but if you're staying in the mountains for overnight and you need to grab your tent , this one is the best .
review.name: I wanna buy another cobra , for 1 day climb

review.reviewBody: I can barely attach overnight equipment on the side, no avalanche pocket even while marketed for ski mountaineering. No bottom strap. Very unimpressed
review.name: Terrible bag for overnighter

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I needed a pack for winter backpacking that would include skiing and ice climbing. This pack fit quite well. For reference I am 5'2", 110lbs with a 14.5 " torso. I really like the floating lid, ice axe carry system, and water resistance of the material. The big winner was the fact I could take out the frame sheet after a heavy load and turn it into a day pack that felt quite comfy and tilt my head all the way back. The harness fit well except the shoulder pads were a bit wide on me so it restricted my overhead arm movement. I am a small person so this is common. Overall nice pack but I ultimately chose a Hyperlite pack. The return was easy and I had great customer service with North Face and will definitely buy from them again.
review.name: Ultimately chose another pack but it was a hard choice.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] If you are a serious, backcountry, Skier or ice Climber, this is the pack you want. You can keep your shovel and wet skins in the back pocket, out of the main compartment with your spare clothing and food and water and beers. Same for your crampons. You can put them in the pocket and know they are not going to fall off your pack.
review.name: Excellent product for serious users.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's a little difficult to get it to fit right with my torso size, but its just big enough to hold overnight gear and all my climbing gear. I use the ski straps to cinch my rope to the sides and never worry about it coming loose or flopping. Really love the ice tool attachments! Front pocket holds my crampons perfectly
review.name: Pretty solid pack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This pack for the most part is pretty simple and light. It is white so it does like to stain but its a backpack.
review.name: Awesome Pack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The best backpack I have ever used. I was planning to go to the Mountains with it and I am so glad to have it.
review.name: The Best Backpack Ever

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Probably the best bag that I have purchased for the mountains! Love every feature about it and well invested for future mountain trips around the states.
review.name: I would buy this product again and recommend it to people.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Beautiful Light weight Easy to clean Large space
review.name: My gf pick it up for me from all kinds of brands

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Seems like they designed a good product and then never field tested it. Works great as a 50L pack, but filled to the brim it's not so great. Crampon pocket doesn't actually fit crampons when fully loaded, wand/picket pockets get turned outwards when fully loaded so they don't work great and would only hold about 10 wands (they need to come up higher and/or go out further). The one gear loop and one hip pocket setup absolutely baffles me. If I'm racking climbing gear, I want it on both sides. Jansport seems to be the only ones who have figured out that you can put on a pocket AND a gear loop so that either can be used based on preference. Ice tool carry is ok, though I prefer the security of buckles over the hook system used here. It's been more of a problem on my Prophet 100. Some great features like the side compression straps can unclip and meet on the back of the pack to carry a snowboard/snowshoes/other bulky items, though those same side straps are way too small to carry a full-length z-lite foam pad. Carries weight comfortably, seems like a good balance of weight vs durability and generally has a streamlined design with just enough features. The redundancy of the rope carry/top closure straps is a bit annoying but thankfully you can just take one off, and I do like that it's only one hook that attaches to the lid of the pack rather than 2 buckles, and the lid is fully removable quickly with buckles to pare down or carry around at camp. I think if you plan on it being a 50-55L climbing pack and you rack gear on your harness you'll be pretty happy. If you want something to carry a fully loaded 65L you'll be disappointed. As a ski pack you'll definitely compromise with no avy tool pocket and no backpanel access, but it's not designed for that.
review.name: Works well at 50L

name: Cobra 65L Backpack

review.reviewBody: I havnt been able to use the pack yet which is why I give only 4 stars. However , I have had this pack on and It’s very comfortable. I’m looking forward to taking on our next trip.
review.name: Great expectations

review.reviewBody: Similar configuration to the Bridger 65, just a tad smaller, but still had plenty of room for everything I needed for the 4 days in the Grand Canyon. Comfortable, durable and well thought out pack. I also used Void Bags to make life even more organized and that much easier unloading and loading everyday at camp. I still have my M.R. Crew Cab which can carry everything and a kitchen sink, but this is my new go to pack!
review.name: Awesome pack for 4 days in the Grand Canyon

review.reviewBody: I bought this pack a week before I was supposed to do a 2day walkthrough in the Mt Baker region of Washington. I didn’t need a whole lot of prep time to get acclimated. To start, how it rested on my hips was amazing. I have almost no hips, very small hip bones and am 5’8” with a bit of a gut but the pack fit tight and sung around may hips and waist and took the pressure off my back. I had ~ 50 pounds and it never felt like a burden. At one point I had a 15lb dog started to my chest and I felt the dog more than the pack. The size is excellent for stowing all the essentials, including a bear bin. The back padding allowed by decent ventilation which is. Important because I sweat a lot. Overall a great purchase and look forward to taking t out again this winter.
review.name: Excellent Pack for an average guy

review.reviewBody:
The Mystery Ranch Bridger 55L has been an absolute game changer for me. When I first started backpacking and hiking. I bought a huge 85 L Kelty Asher and after the first few miles into the trail my shoulders would be killing me and the weight would never seem to shift in the right place to get a comfortable carry. After multiple times trying to find the right weight and strap configuration I had started looking for another pack. 
      
	So I started asking around and shopping online to find the perfect pack for me. At first I was worried about the cost, then the size, and then style. The amount of options that are out there are insane and I would find myself discouraged and overwhelmed with the amount of options and then just inevitably stop looking to buy a new pack. When I was watching the reviews that other creators were talking about and the one that stood out to me the most was the Mystery Ranch Bridger 55 L. 

	I was so worried and excited about the new pack all at the same time. After buying a $300 + backpack, I was suffering, I couldn’t wait for the back pack to get here and at the same time there were moments of doubt and thoughts of “ what makes this pack any different from the other 5 packs Ive tried? “, “ Is this pack going to be worth the money? "
     
	 At last, the pack arrived, of course while I was working, and I couldn’t wait to get home to unbox and see all the cool things I had seen on the reviews. I got home and immediately opened the box and started checking out the new pack. The very first thing I noticed was the materials, everything the pack is made of looks and feels super durable. The next thing was the style, the pack looked awesome for the color I chose. The next thing I noticed was the amount of detail that went into how this pack was constructed. Then I started to think about how I was going to pack all my gear into this pack. And then the oh crap moment hit me.
	
	I started opening up the pack in the way I watched others open the pack and that’s when the zippers really impressed me. Gliding like butter and rugged to the feel. Then the moment came were I was doubting that my gear was going to fit in the pack. I started loading the pack and repacked it 5-6 different ways until I came to what works for me and to my amazement I still had room to add more. I had always bring a camp chair and a table with me but had stoped due to the weight and the other packs digging into my shoulders. With the additional room I had in this pack I went ahead and loaded my chair and table. Then came time to weigh the totals for my pack. Mind you that I bring an average of 65 -70 different things with me in my pack which is a tone of stuff but not really. I set up my pack for 10 + days and nights out including food and I was nervous about the weight but the total weight was 38 Lbs. I put the pack on my back and started the adjustments. Soon within about 45 min I had a comfortable carry. 

	I was thinking that I didn’t pack something as this pack felt like nothing was on my back. I looked around and even went through everything in my pack and everything was there. This made the urge to get out on a trail even more desirable. 

	Time opened up and so my wife and I decided to go to the Emery Creek Fall Trail in Chatsworth GA. Out on the trail the pack was preforming wonderful and was such a great experience as I could finally say that I found the pack that works for me. Mile after mile goes by and the pack was there but caused no issues with hurting my shoulders, hips, or back. We got to the area were the falls are at about 4 miles into the trail and set up a picnic and relaxed. The pack sat on the ground easy and did not seam to carry dirt on it after moving it around to get different items out to use. Hours pass and we packed back up and headed back to the trail head. All the way the pack preformed great. I can’t wait to take the pack out this Fall to explore more of the outdoors.

	This pack has a running vest style sternum strap that really helps distribute the weight around my body. Items are easy to get too and overall I am extremely satisfied with what Im calling an investment and great addition to my gear.
review.name: Im done looking for packs!

review.reviewBody: This pack is by far the most comfortable pack I have ever used. It has been great for long hikes and ruck running. I wish they made this in a hunting version with meat shelf. The adjustability is great and the hip belt is really secure. While running with this packed with about 35 lbs it remained secure with limited bounce. If you don’t mind a bit of a heavier pack this is a great option.
review.name: Most comfortable pack I own.

review.reviewBody: Not the lightest pack but very durable, practical and comfortable.
review.name: Very robust.

review.reviewBody: This pack is exactly what I have been looking for. I just got back from a two week trip with this pack and it worked great. Plenty of space and extremely comfortable. Highly recommend.
review.name: Love this Pack

review.reviewBody: I purchased the pack for multi day, backpacking trips. I bought it a few weeks ago in preparation for for hunting this year, but mostly for next summer’s hiking season, I have yet to use the pack. Looking over the pack in person you can tell that a lot of thought went into the design. It is super comfortable and easy to adjust, there is pockets in all the right places, and the additional pockets on the front straps and lower band are clutch! Couldn’t be happier with my purchase and look forward to using it soon.
review.name: A well put together pack!

review.reviewBody: This pack is extremely well made and feature-rich. I love the vest -style harness and find it very comfortable (I'm 5'11, 155, slim athletic build). The belt is quite robust and I've carried this pack of comfortably up to about 40 lbs.  My nitpicks: I wish the back mesh panel was a looser weave so things could dry out more easily.  The bottom straps are about 4 inches too short.  I wish one of the side pockets were larger and deeper, to allow carrying a tent more easily (Durston x-mid pro in my case).  Needs a water guard zip on the brain as well.  This is a heavy pack, but carries like a champ.  Great for trips with lots of luxury gear like a 2-5 camping trip.  This is too heavy and feature rich for extended through hikes (imo).  Would love to see a slightly pared down version in Ultra 200 hitting the 3 lb mark.
review.name: Great pack overall

review.reviewBody: This pack did everything I wanted it to on a weekend outing. The organization options made the inside feel more spacious than 55L, to the point where I was concerned I was forgetting something because there was too much room left. It carried the weight well and the load always felt well distributed. The many exterior pockets were nice too. My only complaint is that the outside straps on the bottom of the pack are a bit short. They almost did not fit around my tent. Even just an extra inch would have been nice. Minor issue though.
review.name: Great combination of features

name: Bridger 55L Backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Jeans are so tricky to buy anymore! I do love my Carson Jean - it's my first pair, and they fit comfortably and stylishly well. I could use a smidge more length, but am not quite tall enough for a tall size. I am sorry that the inside of the front pockets are white, rather than dyed dark blue like the jeans.
review.name: One small thing. . .

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These jeans are very comfortable. True to size. It’s my third pair and I love them.
review.name: Great pair of jeans

review.reviewBody: I bought these jeans maybe a month ago, and like my first pair of Carson jeans, they did not disappoint. So happy to have jeans that are not high rise, not tight and not wide leg, and are super comfortable. I’m 5’7” 140lbs and athletic thighs and booty, and 6 fits perfectly except the waist. I’m curvy, so it’s not surprising these are a little loose in the waist, but I wear a belt and they’re perfect! I hope some of the other colors are stocked soon, I’ve really found a winner here.
review.name: The perfect jean

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are my new favorite jeans! They are so comfortable, made from soft, quality denim. They are a little longer than I usually like (I am bordering on petite height), but I just roll them up.
review.name: These are my new favorite

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the jeans. I bought one a year ago and it fits perfectly. Ordered two new pairs and they both are almost an inch shorter. 😕 I wish they came in a tall size.
review.name: Too short

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are too stiff and looked unflattering. Had to return them and exchange for a different color.
review.name: Unflattering

review.reviewBody: These are great pants - I’ve been eyeing this style for a while and it’s a little out of my comfort zone (skinny jeans or bust, in my humble opinion), but they’re so perfect for the days I just want to be comfortable but still feel cute. I seriously doubt this will be my last pair.
review.name: These are great pants -

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely Love these Jeans! They fit great! They look great! The material is great. The main thing I love about these is that the waist is right below the Navel. Not high waist, not really low. Just perfect. I have been looking for 3 years for a good Jean in this fit!!
review.name: Perfect Nean

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I ordered the Carson jean in washed grey. They are super comfortable. I have 2 other pairs in a larger size and was finding that they a stretch out by the end of the day and were loose around the waist, so I decided to order a smaller size and love them a little more fitted. They fit great in the waist and have plenty of stretch and feel comfortable all day.
review.name: Sized down and love them!

review.reviewBody: super comfortable. I bought a size smaller than normal and they were still a little big especially after wearing for a few hours
review.name: runs big

name: Carson Jean - Women's

description: Buy the Jetboil Coffee Press online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Coffee Press
hasVariant.description: Buy the Jetboil Coffee Press online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Game changer for camping coffee. No more instant Starbucks for me. Only the real thing from now on. Wish I’d known about this sooner.
review.name: Coffee Press

review.reviewBody: Spent 3 nights on a floating trip made several cups of coffee for myself and friends with no problems.
review.name: Great coffee press

review.reviewBody: The french press feature is useful if you don't want to make instant coffee.

DOES NOT PACK INTO JETBOIL ZIP! I suspect the design has changed at some point as this coffee press does not fit! The official method and what's shown on packaging = No chance in hell!

Cutting the silicone lid protrusions gets closer but still no clearance!
review.name: Feel cheated by jetboil due to design changes
comment: Thank you for leaving your review. Please see the following video at jetboil.com:        https://jetboil.johnsonoutdoors.com/us/how-to/pack-coffee-press-zip-micromo

review.reviewBody: A marked improvement over the original Java press. Less grit and better extraction.
review.name: Definite improvement

review.reviewBody: Solid upgrade from the 1st gen coffee press system. The old format used a plastic plunger w/ "fingers" which would let grounds pass through. The silicone seal definitely reduces the amount of grounds getting through. Overall pleased!
review.name: Better than Gen 1!

review.reviewBody: Plunger pushed through press first time I used it. Good idea, cheap components.
review.name: Coffee Press Issue
comment: Thank you for your review. For any issue you may be having with this Coffee Press, please contact Customer Service toll-free at 1-800-572-8822 M-F between 8am and 4:30pm EST. We will be happy to assist you.

review.reviewBody: Needs a protective carrier, store in cup will damage
review.name: Good, could be better.

review.reviewBody: The press worked great at first but once the press itself was consistently used for a month while in the field, the press pushes right through the lid/press attachment and no longer is able to press the coffee and leaves you with grounds throughout your entire pot. This is unacceptable for it's price point.
review.name: Broken Press
comment:
Thank you for taking the time to leave your review! I am sorry to hear of the trouble that you are having with your coffee press and would like the opportunity to speak with you to assist you further on that concern. Please contact us at your convenience, 1-800-572-8822 8am-5pm EST Monday-Friday.

We would be happy to hear from you!

review.reviewBody: Well built, high quality press. It's just not great at pressing coffee and trapping the grounds. I went back to using instant coffee. Worth a try tho.
review.name: Press can't overcome the operator's ineptitude
comment: Thank you for taking the time to reach out! We would like the opportunity to speak with you to assist you further on your concerns with this. Please contact us at your convenience, 1-800-572-8822 8am-5pm EST Monday-Friday. We would look forward to talking to you!!

name: Coffee Press

Buy the Coleman Camp Burst Tent: 4-Person online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Camp Burst Tent: 4-Person
hasVariant.description: Buy the Coleman Camp Burst Tent: 4-Person online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Easy to put up, taking it back down was a little confusing but it just takes some practice I think.
review.name: Easy to put up

review.reviewBody: Large- well made tent (2 people and a full sized mattress fits nicely) and the windows provide ample breeze and beautiful view. Super easy to put up and take down. The style of tent is cool too. Watch out for pinch points when folding and recommend buying a tarp to put under the tent.
review.name: Super nice upgrade! Will not disappoint.

review.reviewBody: I am a weekend camper who was looking for a tent that is easy to put up and take down by one person.  This tent fits the bill perfectly!  It's easy to carry, goes up in under 4 minutes, is well constructed, and is easy to take down.  And it's roomy inside with great ventilation.
review.name: Love This Tent!

review.reviewBody: We just received the tent and excitedly set it up in the house and WOW, it really was a breeze to set up! I'm taking my daughter on a two night camping trip with Girl Scouts and we needed our own tent.  This one delivers on ease of setup (just lay it out and lift the middle ~30 seconds) & disassembly.  It was back in the bag in less than 5 minutes. The bag is roomy and it wasn't a fight to get it back in.   We bought some low cots (6in off ground) so I think this is a great tent for two people.  I cannot imagine 4 though.  I would. be very interested in purchasing a much larger version of this so that our entire family could stay in one tent...I hope one is in the works :)
review.name: Ridiculously easy setup/disassembly!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the easiest tent to set up, that I have ever owned. The poles are integral with the design,  so there is no assembly. No hassle of trying to put poles together and thread them through the material. You basically just pull up the center piece like an umbrella and you have a tent.  You do need to steak it down along with rope tie downs. That is the only part that takes a few minutes. The tent is very spacious and my kids love to use it for play in the back yard. I let them do that mainly because of the ease of set up.
review.name: Easy set up

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This tent is spacious and blue! Easy to fold up and fold down. Straps are simple to put into place. Good rain screen in case of a storm. Can fit many people or children. Good for camping. Good for beach too
review.name: Big and blue

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We have set this up a few times in the house for kids sleepovers. As it's been to cold to do it outside. It was not to difficult to set up. Works well for what we have used it for. Seems sturdy. Water somehow got spilled on it and it didn't leak through. I can't wait to use it for camping.
review.name: Bigger than I thought

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is by far the best tent on the market, Coleman really outdid itself! What did it for me was the initial set up process, to say this tent was easy to set up would be an understatement. Once set up, the tent will not break down and does fit 4 people. The pockets come in handy and all the seals work as expected. I highly recommend this to anyone that loves to camp and have fun outdoors!
review.name: Best tent on the market!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Amazing tent! Super spacious, me and my girlfriend went camping and her brother and his gf. The tent they brought had broken within the first day. They all moved into our tent, it was absolutely perfect no issues at all

It's ideal for fall hiking in the Cascades...and I chose the bright orange color for great pictures. This is super warm too. I was so impressed with this hoodie, I will be buying for friends and family for Christmas.

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Pullover Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: Depending on weather works good alone or under a wind shirt. Under a puffy as a mid layer in colder weather. Fits me well.
review.name: Vigor grid fleece

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Pullover Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I ordered a size Large (my usual size for tops), and it was a very tight fit around my arms and upper chest. I have an LL Bean waffle fleece hoodie that fits more comfortably and it's a size Medium.

It's a nice hoodie, but definitely buy at least one size up.
review.name: Runs really small

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Pullover Hoodie - Men's

review.name: Best mid layer in the world

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Pullover Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: I liked this hoodie so much I bought 2 more in different colors. Fits great and keeps you warm!
review.name: Exactly what I wanted

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Pullover Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: Stretchy, incredibly warm thanks to the grid fleece, and offers an excellent fit. Plus, the balaclava style hood keeps your face warm and layers perfectly under your outer Layers! My only regret is that I should have bought 2
review.name: My favorite fleece

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Pullover Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: Brought this hoodie with me to the Volcano national Park and needed it in lower temps.
review.name: Great hoodie super comfortable and incredibly warm.

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Pullover Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love this product but it runs small. Usually wear a medium but the M pullover is pretty tight on me.
review.name: Love but Runs Tight

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Pullover Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: I am 5'10" and 160lbs and medium fits well. It is perfect snug level to fit under a lightweight down jacket and shell ski jacket in CO. It is more snug than I would want for an everyday shirt, which is maybe why some didn't like this? The hood and neck keeps me warm without choking me. It is super comfortable. I would recommend it.
review.name: Love it as a base layer for skiing

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Pullover Hoodie - Men's
review.reviewBody: I wanted to love the Vigor Grid Fleece Pullover, but unfortunately I had to return it. The grid fleece material is comfortable and warm yet light and breathable enough for high output activities. The sleeve length is excellent (I find other brands' sleeves to often run too long). I also really like the hood shape and size. As other reviews point out, the arms are snug, which can be a drawback if you have bigger arms. The chest / side seams are the deal-breaker for me. The pullover has stiff seams that intersect with the chest in front of the armpit and run down the length of the garment. However, on someone with narrower shoulders / lats, the seam placement and construction cause the seams to fight back against arm movement, totally negating any benefits of the stretch material. Raising my arms above my head, for instance, caused the pullover to lift up above my belly.
review.name: Weird fit; not for bigger arms or narrower shoulders / lats

name: Vigor Grid Fleece Pullover Hoodie - Men's

review.reviewBody: great outdoor shoe, however the lace system is trash
review.name: great outdoors

review.reviewBody: Big fan on the Phantoms. Ran my first pair until I had inch wide holes and finally caved to buy another pair. I downsized a half size from my street size 11 to 10.5 and the shoe fits me absolutely perfectly. Toes are turbo locked in. Heel fits my rather knobby kneels just right. Also rocking a pair of zenist pros that I use for compy stuff and smeary slab problems, and using Phantoms (my beloved) for overhang, small chippy problems, and board climbing.
review.name: My beloved

review.reviewBody: These shoes are definitely my favorite so far. I have tried Solutions, Instincts, and dragos. this shoe has so much rubber and after about 2 weeks the shoes will soften up. Super supportive for edges but not the most sensitivity. I would definitely recommend these shoes for someone that toe hooks and heel hooks a lot. The heel is surprisingly padded and was not as sensitive as I would have wanted but is nice when I am bouldering outdoors on sharp holds
review.name: Amazing climbing shoes

review.reviewBody:
Ordered my street shoe size (10) after 4 climbing sessions they stretched about half a size and have a perfect but super snug fit. Only complaint is that the stitching on the back on the inside rubs the back of my foot and hurts if I climb too many days in a row.
Otherwise they are great for heel and toe hooks and they are super sticky and give me a-lot of confidence on tiny footholds.

The sizing is pointless. I wear M 5.5 (W7.5). I went two sizes up and ordered size M 7.5 and couldn’t even fit my foot in the shoe. I went one more size up to 8.5 and still couldn’t fit my tiny foot in there. So I returned both sizes and gave up.

I would probably have to go 4 sizes up (from 5.5 to 9.5. I know that the fit should feel snug, but this is like I can’t physically fit my foot in there, it’s painful.
review.name: Ridiculously small

review.reviewBody: I bought this shoe a few mounths ago
review.name: Great shoe!

review.reviewBody: I came from Zenist Pro (my first pair from EVOLV). I wanted something more curved. Phantoms are different than anything what I tried. Really aggressive but perfectly functional shape. The lace system is exceptional, easy put on and off, crank down on feet like nothing else. They are comfy out of box (actually for me more comfy then ZenPro which are also awesome). Really good precision on toes, heel is super sensitive but less powerful than ZenPro which has more structured heel cup - I prefer Phantoms heel, it fits more precise, and the heel rand is pain free (zenist pro goes tear my achilles after hour) Smearing is for now average but for me good enough. Really special feeling shoe, worth the hype. For me all I need - I will stick with these for while.
review.name: The Beast!

review.reviewBody:
Previously, my best option was Scarpa Drago LV, and I've grown fond of the soft shoe. However, it had something to improve for me:
- Heel (it was a bit baggy)
- Centered toebox (my big toes got tired a lot and started to hurt at the end of the sessions)
- Enough support on the small/sharp footholds.

Phantoms solved all of the above. Heel fits me perfectly, and I've used heelhooks on the holds I've never thought it was possible for me to do so before. Toebox shape is great for my big toes health (considering I have a previously injured one). They don't hurt after long sessions, like they used to. And needless to say a stiffer shoe provides more support.
I was going for Zenist Pros first, because I was afraid that Phantoms wouldn't work for smearing. Zenist Pro didn't fit me well (I couldn't squish my feet through the high toe rubber patch), so decided to stick with Phantoms. And to my surprise smearing is great in them. Somehow it works and provides enough sensitivity despite being a very aggressive shoe.
review.name: Best fitting climbing shoe I've had so far

review.reviewBody: Stiff shoes, great for edging. Took a while to break in - but comfortable once done. Would buy again.
review.name: Stiff but Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Heel fits perfectly. Not a sensitive shoe, but sticky rubber and aggressive shape.
review.name: Great sport/bouldering shoe

name: Phantom Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: I've had this helmet for the 3 last seasons and its performed flawlessly. I use it for both inbounds and backcountry skiing. Its low profile and quite light compared to other helmets. I use it with my Smith I/O mag goggles and both goggle and helmet work well together (can't speak to other goggle makes/models though).
review.name: Excellent helmet

review.reviewBody: This helmet fits me perfectly, it has the safest technology and good looks. It is also very light compared to most helmets.
review.name: Best Helmet I've Ever Had

review.reviewBody: This is my first ski helmet, and I am overall quite happy with it. It fits me very well, is not too heavy, and looks...well, it looks great if you like the astronaut look. (I don't, but after two concussions, one bike riding and another skiing, I thought I'd better wear one.) There is only one problem: the wind blows in around my ears and is rather chilly. That's OK when it's 35 degrees out, but I ski in New England and it gets REAL cold here. So now I'm looking for a beanie to wear under it, against all advice, and contrary to the common wisdom that "helmets are warmer than hats."
review.name: Fits Well But Breezy

review.reviewBody: This helmet is warm, durable and barley feels like anything is even on your head! I love it for touring in any condition and for bell to bell days at the resort! Highly recommend!
review.name: Best helmet I have owned!

review.reviewBody: This helmet fits great. It is super light and fits seamlessly with the giro goggles. Highly recommend!
review.name: Best fitting helmet

review.reviewBody: Sleek design paired with a well thought out ventilation system is hard to beat. Adjustability makes this helmet super comfortable in seconds. Paired with some Giro goggles makes for a seamless, fogless fit. Add the MIPS feature and you can't pass this up, super solid!
review.name: Best in the game

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, comfortable, and the venting system is super effective in keeping your noggin nice and cool. Favorite thing is the vent integrated into the brim of the helmet, which allows your goggles to breathe and prevents fog. Nobody likes goggy foggles.
review.name: Stellar dome piece

name: Jackson Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: Awesome quality inside and out & really warm for the weight!
review.name: Awesome quality inside and out

review.reviewBody: The first thing that strikes you taking the bag from its dry bag (nice touch) is the immense loft from something so small in size. It kept filling up beyond what I thought possible. Next is the quality. It might be ultra light weight, but every element feels just right. The bag reduces grammes in several techy ways, but it's the shiny interior that stands out. Imagine a breathable cloth version of one of those emergency foil blankets they throw round marathon runners as they finish. Warmth is excellent. First time out was -8°C which is right at the edge of what RAB says is meant to be perfectly comfortable and - yes! - I'd say that was a cautious rating. The baffles and drawstrings are simple and the zip is small, but I found these all worked intelligently and was a good balance for what is a seriously featherweight bag. I'm struggling to find a negative in the bag itself. Price is expensive, but it's a RAB bag you're buying - and top of the line.
review.name: Tardis RAB Bag

review.reviewBody:
These are my first "high end" bibs. I bought them because a friend who loves them told me they were on sale. They are worth it. They are the best bibs I have ever own. I've had a lot issues with chafing and saddle sores, especially as I've been building up my ride distance. These bibs have helped tremendously. 

My one critique is that I still prefer to remove my kit for restroom stops. I don't love the drop down feature but it will work in a pinch.
review.name: I love these bibs

review.reviewBody: Ordered these in a small. Definitely felt very tight on my legs- I have pretty big thighs. 5’2 125#. Sized up to medium and they are great. I’ve used them about 5x now and the chamois is super comfortable. I really like the mesh too
review.name: So comfortable!

review.reviewBody: I wasn't too sure about these bibs at first due to the full mesh front, but wow are these comfortable! The fabric is silky smooth with just the right amount of compression and I love the laser-cut leg opening and minimalistic leg grippers. The fit is slightly more generous than most of the Italian brands, so if you're looking for a truly compressive fit, you might want to size down. My only gripe is that after a few washes, the mesh front has attracted a bit of dog hair that is impossible to get out. But overall, these are amazing and will definitely be working their way into my regular rotation.
review.name: LUXE is an understatement

name: LUXE Bib Short - Women's

description: Buy the Coleman 20Qt 1900 Steel Belted Cooler online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: 20Qt 1900 Steel Belted Cooler
hasVariant.description: Buy the Coleman 20Qt 1900 Steel Belted Cooler online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The cooler is on the smaller side, but it’s perfect for a single person or small group. I actually like the smaller size because it’s easier to transport and place in an easy to reach area without taking up too much space. Insulation was exactly what I’d want out of a cooler - drinks remained cold for pretty much the whole day, and the seal is strong - no leaks were apparent. The aesthetic is classy, vintage and practical, which I love. The build itself seems to be really good quality - the handles and latch are sturdy metal and I’m not worried about either mechanisms breaking if handled too roughly. The built in bottle opener is a nice touch as well. Very pleased!
review.name: Classy and Functional

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love how durable it is.It's very portable to take anywhere and that's very good insulation.So it keeps stuff cold and it's very big for all my stuff and I love the colors on it and the design of it.I will literally carry this everywhere
review.name: Keep stuff cool

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very durable.. love the colors and style! Insulation is very nice but does make it a lil heavy with the metal exterior. Capacity is great for using in car for groceries or picnics.
review.name: Coleman vintage design

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Coleman 1900 SB Cooler in 20Q size is a beautiful cooler! The 1900 Collection has all the charm and feel of the vintage models in a shiny new advanced package. This cooler is very classy looking! It is the perfect cooler to take along for a day at the park, out on the boat, or anytime you would like to have cold drinks stashed away on the go. 
The cooler is featured in a nice black metal and gray color scheme, featuring brass and steel hardware and hinges with a stainless steel lid. On looks alone, this cooler is a beauty! I am pleased to report that it functions as well as it looks. 
This cooler is compact and reasonably lightweight. If features steel-belted construction, making it very durable. It will hold an entire case of 12 ounce cans plus ice, and you will still have a little room left over for some extras. 
We typically purchase rotomolded coolers, which are obnoxiously heavy, but effective, so were skeptical about the capabilities of this cooler. The cold time on this cooler did not disappoint. It successfully kept our drinks ice cold for our day trip and we were overall quite impressed with its functionality. I expect we could get at least a day or two of cold. The weight is very reasonable and I could easily carry it empty and manage to move it when full, making this an excellent choice for a grab and go cooler. 
If you are looking for a really aesthetically pleasing, but also quite functional cooler, the Coleman 1900 is a great choice!
review.name: Beautiful Compact Portable Cooler

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely love this item. I'm so glad I was chosen to test this item. I love the design, and it's very well insulated. Very portable and durable!
review.name: Good ite.

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This day trip cooler has fully met my expectations. The first thing that catches your eye is its stylish vintage design. It looks really cool and expensive thanks to the metal body. It is convenient to take with you on picnics or the beach - the size is optimal, not too big and not too small, about 6 bottles of 1 liter fit plus ice. 
The insulation is excellent: we left in the morning and returned late in the evening, the drinks remained cold throughout the day, even in hot weather. The lid closes tightly, nothing leaks. Of course, it is a little heavier than plastic models because of the metal, but for me this is not a problem - on the contrary, it feels reliable and sturdy. 
Of the minuses, I will note that it is still a bit small for large companies. 
If you are looking for a quality cooler for short trips, this is an ideal option.
review.name: Goof

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It’s supposed to hold 17 cans plus 11 lbs of ice to keeps things really chilled. But I could easily fill it with 30 cans and still have room for ice and ice water to chill sodas. It really holds a good amount but the cooler itself is on the smaller side which is perfect size for my family. The sides are metal which gives it this cool retro aesthetic look. The handles and lock closure are thick metal. The lid is insulated. It’s absolutely gorgeous and I can’t wait to travel with it.
review.name: Absolutely gorgeous retro looking cooler

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’m in love with this cooler so much. If you are looking for something that is durable, sleek design, and modern, then this is better than their competitor (which I also own). I’ve been looking for a hard cooler for some time, but dislike other brands due to their tacky design. This cooler is a piece of art. Black with gold trim. Not too heavy. Holds a lot of drinks. Perfect for that outdoor party on the deck or transporting food up to the cabin. This would be awesome for camping too. Keeps things cold and easy to clean. Nice non-slip grips on the handles for easy carrying too.
review.name: It’s gorgeous

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] you're looking for a cooler that combines style, practicality, and a nod to outdoor heritage, the Coleman 1900 Collection is definitely worth considering. It’s a piece of history that enhances every outdoor experience, making it memorable and enjoyable.
review.name: Awesome Design

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] i love this cooler, it looks so sleek easy to carry around. the insulation is quite good. when putting it down it has bumpers to stop scratching. it’s a good side for a portable cooler.
review.name: great

name: 20Qt 1900 Steel Belted Cooler

description: Buy the Smith Attack MAG MTB ChromaPop Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Attack MAG MTB ChromaPop Sunglasses
hasVariant.description: Buy the Smith Attack MAG MTB ChromaPop Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought these glasses and the plastic tab on the corner of the lenses broke off within first month of use. Smith would not honor their warranty on a broken product that has been barely used. I was able to fix the first issue with some super glue on my own. However, since then, the little magnet has popped up out of its place on the arm and is not impossible to slid into its holder on the lenses. Again, all within the first 2 months of use and Smith will not honor their warranty. Would not recommend buying these poorly made/designed glasses.
review.name: Absolute junk that Smith won't stand behind

review.reviewBody: These are good glasses but they are not fit for purpose. After a while, tabs on the lenses break off because of the accumulation of grit and sweat. I have gone through 4 replacement lenses which were previously covered under warranty but Smith has decided not to any longer. I can't recommend anyone spending 400 on a pair of MTB glasses that are designed poorly and simply don't last.
review.name: Lens Tab Regularly Breaks due to Poor Design

review.reviewBody: They work great, look cool and have unmatched quality. Another exceptional Smith product.
review.name: They work great, look cool

review.reviewBody: As a rider that has been mountain biking since, well, before mountain bikes existed, I am at an age where some things are a little bit of a challenge. Sunglasses for me fell into that area. My, um, mature eyes could no longer pick up detail under the trees when riding single track, and definitely could not adjust fast enough to changing light conditions going in and out of the forest with normal sunglasses. Yes I tried other photochromatic glasses, but they just did not change tint fast enough. These are different. They go from pretty close to clear in the woods to plenty dark enough in the open. They have given me back the ability to ride with sunglasses instead of clear lenses. I have been impressed with how incredibly crisp things look when using these glasses. That was an added bonus, The fact that they seem to walk a nice line in terms of blocking wind, yet not fogging up has also been great. I often forget that I am wearing them. Yes the price is premium, but worth every penny.
review.name: Attack Mag MTB Photochromatic

review.reviewBody: I’ve been through 5 sets of lenses. All have broken at the lens/earpiece junction. Twice just while holding them and wiping the lens with a cloth. For a while, Smith was helpful and honored their warrantee. That has come to an end. Bummer, as they fit well.
review.name: Incredibly fragile

review.reviewBody: I use the MTB attack for mountain biking, road/gravel cycling, ski touring, XC skiing and hiking. What I love about them most - they don't fog yet the lens/frame wraps your face so no matter where the sun is, or how much dust is around, your vision is not affected. I have two pairs of these glasses and four lenses but find the photochromic works for all round. I can't say enough good things about these sunglasses for my sensitive, contact wearing eyes.
review.name: the BEST sunglasses

review.reviewBody:
I’m surprised that other people don’t seem to have the issues with these glasses that I have. They sit too close to my face. My eyelashes touch the lenses when I blink, which is annoying. More importantly, on climbs when I’m moving slowly or when I stop, they immediately fog up (again because I think they’re too close to my face). I’m using them primarily for mountain biking in New York where it can be humid but it’s not the PNW.
I also separately bought the photochromic replacement lens (didn’t come with the color I got), and they really don’t get dark/transition well at all. Smith claims 20-85% VLT. I’d guess more like 60%-85%.
review.name: Sit too close to the face, fog issues

review.reviewBody:
I've used the heck out of these glasses since I got them 6 months again. They're comfortable on the face and stay in place well. However, the quality isn't quite there. The lenses have started to delaminate and one of the connection points is loose on the lens as well. Also, maybe I just sweat too much, but I've had to start carrying a microcloth on my rides to keep the lenses clear of sweat mid ride...even when wearing a Halo band under my helmet. 

With that being said...Smith has world class customer service. Sent them a quick photo of the issue and they had a resolution for me within the day. Love the brand.
review.name: Good. Not great.

name: Attack MAG MTB ChromaPop Sunglasses

description: Buy the Sea To Summit Telos TR2 Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Telos TR2 Tent: 2-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Telos TR2 Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Shockingly easy to set up, the rod color coding made it surprisingly intuitive. I’m a big fan of the double-sided doors and the inside is surprisingly spacious. Does not come with the footprint or any type of mesh repair, which sucks because I noticed a small hole in the mesh after the first use. Overall pretty sweet! Haven’t tried out in colder weather but the 6-in tub feature makes me want to
review.name: First impressions

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was sold on the flexibility and roominess of this tent in a lightweight package. This is my 6th tent and by far my favorite. Set up is easy and it performs well in cold, wet, or clear skies. Looking forward to more backpacking and camping adventures in this tent!
review.name: Telos 2P Tent - flexible, tall, lightweight

review.reviewBody: This is another SeaToSummit outstanding product! I went from camping in heavy Kodiak Canvas to a tiny Telos TR2 - Two Person Freestanding Tent. This tent is incredibly light weight and suitable for air travel. It conveniently packs up into 3 small stuff sacs that are provided. Freestanding is great, especially when you're trying to set up on a wood platform. Most of my camping is during the summertime months or in warm climates. I brought this with me down to the USVI and the screens gave me plenty of airflow. I had zero issues with moisture. Personally, I do miss the optional zip up and down windows. I think that option would afford an individual a bit more privacy and night time warmth. As of yet, I haven't personally tent camped during a heatwave.
review.name: Telos TR2 - Two Person Freestanding Tent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Took it out beach camping. The online instructions are very much needed bc the paper manuals are useless for construction of the tent. Not very intuitive and I've built a lot of tents. Ventilation was good, and very spacious. I think I could set it up now in like 5-10min. One big factor is trying to figure out the tents orientation. All the extra vertical space of the tent makes it strange trying to find the center.
review.name: Excellent tent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This tent replaces a well-worn SD Clip Flashlight. The Telos is about the same weight, a bit less bulk but considerably roomier on the inside both floorspace and headroom-wise. Important consideration is that the Telos is free standing whereas the CF absolutely had to be staked out. Not a big deal on a forest floor or meadow but much of our useage is streamside, sand and gravel bars. As usual, Sea to Summit's design and engineering is thoughtful and innovative, down to simple things like color coding parts and the modular stuff sack. These guys make crazy good stuff!
review.name: Great shelter at minimum weight and bulk

review.reviewBody: This tent worked perfectly. I took it on a week long canoe trip in Maine last week. Had a mix of weather conditions. Two nights dropped to freezing with a heavy frost. One night had heavy rain. The fly cinched down very nicely and nothing got wet. Tent is super light and packed nicely into one of my dry bags. Once set up it was very sturdy in the wind and rain. Im 6 ft tall and liked the wide area for head room and I didn’t have issues getting in and out. I would definitely recommend buying the ground tarp which actually attaches to the tent frame itself so there was no slippage and nothing hung out with the rain. I also got the gear loft which was nice for me because I always seem to loose things while sleeping. Overall I would definitely recommend.
review.name: Excellent tent

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The tent has lots of thoughtful features that improve the experience compared to other tents, particularly the light bar and the gear bags that double as stuff sacks. Only been used once so I can't comment on long term usage, but so far I'm very happy with the purchase. The guy lines are also incredibly easy to use, although I'm curious how long they will last. 

What keeps it from five stars is the stakes aren't as durable as I would've liked (wife bent one the first time using), and the hangout mode setup is not practical for a single person in anything but dead still wind, a slight breeze makes this thing difficult.
review.name: The tent has lots of

review.reviewBody:
Easy set-up and breakdown, quality material, very roomy for 2 people. Invest in the footprint and the $20 gear loft - which should be included honestly. 

This tent right there with the BA Copper Spur 2.
review.name: Fantastic Tent

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] TL;DR - Really roomy and comfortable, lots of clever features and tons of storage space. Tent and fly bags are too small and make packing the tent up difficult.

I was very excited for this tent. The amount of clever features was intriguing to me. As advertised there is headroom to spare inside the tent, and it makes a huge difference compared to other tents. Much more comfortable when changing, or just hanging out inside. The addition of using the tent bags as storage sacks inside the tent is great. S2S even provided mesh pockets already so the tent bags are just extra bonus storage space. If you bought the gear loft then it's a game changer as well. 

The only con I really have about this tent is the size of the bags for the tent and fly. They're just too small, which makes rolling up and packing the tent away a fairly annoying process. It feels like there's no room to spare so if you don't roll it up just perfectly tight enough then it's going to be a struggle, or impossible, to get back in the bag. And if you manage to just barely get the tent and fly in then the sleeves for the poles are likely to be too tightly stretched to get the poles in.

All in all I'd recommend it but practice rolling up and packing the tent away before going out to camp.
review.name: Really clever tent, just hard to pack up

review.reviewBody: One of the better three season tent until the poles gave up. Was replaced and experienced the same issue.
review.name: Poles not as Sturdy

name: Telos TR2 Tent: 2-Person 3-Season

description: Buy the Klymit Maxfield 2 Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Maxfield 2 Tent: 2-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Klymit Maxfield 2 Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Held up in serious rain storms x2 in national parks without a leak while other tents in adjacent campsites didn’t fare so well.  

Moderately difficult to assemble.  I don’t know if it needs more directions or needs a more straightforward center pole system but was helpful to watch a video beforehand.  After retiring my MSR system  this was definitely a different level of setup.  

It’s reasonably lightweight- was good for our family but with 3 young kids we haven’t ventured into backpacking trips yet with them so used it for car camping.  The footprint that we purchased separately was key.  

Overall, quite pleased.

Took this tent for a few trips that were a couple days each. Super light for how many people you can fit in it. Very easy to set up and tear down. The way it sits in the bag is great.  We did experience some condensation on the inside with the vents open. But we did have four people inside the fly was zipped up and it was not very windy out. Overall highly recommend for hiking trips where light weight and a multiple person tent is needed.
review.name: Very light, easy to put up and spacious for 4p

review.reviewBody: Only complaints would be I wish it was a free standing tent and that it came with a footprint. Other than that, it was a quick setup and take down. Roomier than I had expected for a 2 person. Overall a good quality tent.

Used it for the first time for a 3 night backcountry trip where I was over 5 miles in and hauling a 50lb pack. Easy setup once you practice a couple times. It’s not quite standard with the alignment of the poles and isn’t symmetrical (by design) but it makes sense once it is setup. I like size and weight for what it is.
review.name: Great backpacking tent

review.reviewBody: Upon first set-up, the mesh body wall ripped. Return to Vehicle: used spare.
review.name: Immediate Body Rip - Tent Wall
comment: We are sorry to hear that you are not fully satisfied. Your feedback is important to us, and we'd like to address your concerns. Please contact us at support@klymit.com or 1-888-655-3632 so we can work on improving your experience. Your satisfaction is our top priority.

review.reviewBody: The tent sets up and tears down easily. It’s roomy for one person and cozy for two, and it packs down pretty small and light. My only wish is that it came with the additional stakes needed to further stretch out the rain fly. This would add some rain protection AND ventilation having space between he tent and the fly. I also wish it came with the footprint, which, like the stakes, you have to buy separately.
review.name: Great tent - wish it came with more stakes and footprint

review.reviewBody: The tent was the best value weight tent I could find. It performed well at 12,500 feet. Once you set it up once, it is easy to use. The roll up bag is makes it easy to take down and pack. The fly cords are great design. The fly covers the tens 100 percent so no corners are showing. I will definitely try to use just the fly on a trip next summer. It had room for two adults and packs, the vestibule was great extra space.
review.name: Great Price and weight

review.reviewBody: Used on Maroon Bell Pass backpacking trip. Was lightweight, spacious, and easy to setup / teardown.
review.name: Easy & quick setup - Single backpacker 6'3.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great tent. Lightweight, zipper and fabric quality is real good. Instructions are easy. Fast setup and takedown. Fit 2 adults comfortably.
review.name: Great tent for Backpacking.

review.reviewBody:
I really wish that I read this tent was not free standing prior to purchase. I primarily use tents in the high sierras where tent stake use may not be an option in the hard packed soil with rock. 
My last trip out I had to find rocks to hold my stakes down for my fly. If I had this tent at the time, I don’t think the rocks I found would have been enough to hold the tent flat. 
If I could return it, I probably would, and purchase a free standing tent. But I the site doesn’t look like I can. 
If you camp in an area where tent stakes are easy to use, I believe this tent will be very nice due to its ease of set up and space inside.
review.name: Not free standing.
comment: We are sorry to hear that you are not fully satisfied. Your feedback is important to us, and we'd like to address your concerns. Please contact us at support@klymit.com or 1-888-655-3632 so we can work on improving your experience. Your satisfaction is our top priority.

review.reviewBody: This is some pretty crazy chalk. The Tokyo Powder line is set up so you choose which chalk you need depending on humidity along with your own body (sweaty hands or dry hands). I decided the V16 was the best fit for me and where I'm usually climbing and it seems to be doing great. Do I NEED this particular chalk? review.itemreviewed: Pro Endur Distance Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’m sure the foam they’re using is great and all, but the upper of this shoe is a nightmare. Honestly, I couldn’t tell what the ride was like because my feet were screaming less than a mile in. There’s really no substance to the upper and no matter how much you loosen the laces you’ll get zero relief. Poor design and even worse quality control. This shoe never should’ve left the drawing board. Are they light? Sure. But if they’re saying weight is at such a premium that they can’t put cushion in the upper, particularly the tongue, that’s a devil’s bargain. An extra ounce isn’t going to make one bit of difference. The true reason is probably cost and speed of MFG. Sorry, Craft. I really wanted to like these, but WOW. What a miss.
review.name: Worst. Shoe. Ever.

name: Pro Endur Distance Running Shoe - Men's
