hasVariant.name: Bombshelter Tent: 4-Person 4-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Bombshelter Tent: 4-Person 4-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I loved the size of the tent but I didnt like the difficulty of setup, especially in the rain. After setting up, lots of water was inside the tent and that made for an uncomfortable night. The great thing about the tent is that its light, its easy to pack up, and its strong. We had tropical storm winds of 60MPH and higher and the tent held up to the wind. The tent is also strong, its tough enough to handle a high wind and small debris hitting it. This is helpful when high in the mountains.
review.name: Great overall tent

review.reviewBody:
Bought this tent for a Denali expedition and have also used it backpacking & for summer alpine adventures (above 9,000ft). 

For Denali, I was glad to have brought this tent & would bring it again. I put seem-sealer on all the seams for extra strength, brought lots of guy-lines (only ended up using about half of them), and practiced setting up the tent on some backpacking trips to get a feel for it. On Denali, I really appreciated how fast it was to setup (about 5 minutes) so we could get out of the cold faster. It had lots of strong & reinforced tie-down points (appreciated their toughness as pulling/chipping frozen guy lines out of the ice wasn't always easy). The tent poles/structure is pretty rigid when setup & the tent fabric is also pretty taught when setup so it didn't need much guying out and it didn't move/shake as much in wind (ear plugs were still nice for high wind). The bright yellow tent material was great for team moral on stormy days (always feels bright & sunny inside the tent). The yellow Todd-Tex fabric felt pretty tough and waterproof (the yellow Todd-Tex fabric over the main body seems more waterproof than the grey vestibule material which feels like it maybe has a urethane coating on the inside). The yellow Todd-Tex fabric did get a lot of frost/condensation by morning (mostly just by our heads). I brought a spong to soak it up, and that worked perfect. The tent fit 2 very comfortably with all our winter-camping gear inside along the perimeter of the tent. Fits 3 with some winter camping gear in both vestibules. We fit 5 with no gear in the tent while playing cards during storm days. 

For non-snowy summer alpine adventures (above 9,000ft), it fits 3 very comfortably with summer gear in one vestibule. Can get a little hot inside in the middle of the day, but it's nice to be a little warmer at night. The large vestibule has a U-shaped zipper that is a little harder to enter/exit in the summer (b/c you can't dig a snow pit in front of the door), so I usually have guests use the other vestibule (with the straight zipper) to enter/exit.
review.name: Quality Expedition/Alpine Tent

review.reviewBody: Works perfectly with my F-250.  Easy to set up and break down

A true 4-man 4-season expedition tent.  The pole design is rugged and the materials are tough.  The weight is very competitive for a 4-man 4-season, in part because of the single wall design.  Condensation is always a risk with a single wall design, but so far none of my expeditions in the North Cascades have suffered from any significant amount.  As far as the size goes, this tent does accommodate four medium-size climbers without gear.  I prefer to limit the party to three, which leaves a little room inside the tent for essential and eliminates the need to climb over your partner when entering/exiting the tent.  The only reason I don't give this five stars is that the pole pockets are slightly undersized for proper pole retention, and the design of the pole cross-over ties could be improved for better retention.
review.name: The BD Bombshelter Earns it Name

name: Bombshelter Tent: 4-Person 4-Season

Just enough for good movement 
Comfortable
review.name: Just perfect and enough

review.reviewBody: Fits great , way better than my evs set.  Holds right in place, comfortable too
review.name: Fits great

review.reviewBody: Couldn’t be more satisfied! Very comfortable. My old knee pads irritated the back of my knee. With these I actually forget they are on they are so comfortable! Definitely worth the money!
review.name: Don’t buy anything else! A+

review.reviewBody: Replaced my worn out Leatt stuff with these.  Fit is even more comfortable — I don’t notice them when riding, no pressure points or hot spots.  Happy with my choice
review.name: Good upgrade over my old set

review.reviewBody: Bought these after buying some cheep-o knee/shin braces with no bend and the difference is incredible! These are very comfortable when riding and feel like they offer good protection with the main guard on the knee and extra padding around the knee, although for a guy with some meaty thighs the XL is still at its max size so keep that in mind when ordering.
review.name: My new favorite knee pads!

name: 6.0 3DF Knee Guard

review.reviewBody: I'm actually really surprised that I don't care for these rain boots. My four year old has been putting on/taking his shoes/rain boots since he was two. I'm really disappointed as these are his rainy season boots and he will be using them daily. He has to use thin socks, which for rainy, Oregon winters, is not ideal.

review.reviewBody: I have this sweater in four different colors.  It fits perfectly and is super warm!
review.name: Great sweater!!

review.reviewBody: I really wanted this to be a keeper, but the cut was just not flattering on me. I'm 5'3", 140 lb, 34D and it just made me look very heavy on top. The fabric is really soft, with a cute pattern and a nice color. I really like Carve's style, but feel that a lot of their pieces are cut for thin bodies (like the models they use) and this was one that was not flattering on my curvier bod.
review.name: Not cut for curves

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The length is super short. I started with a large which fit great but for the length. I exchanged for an XL. The XL wider but not longer which is a mystery to me. Keeping it because it is soft and and great quality and I can wear it on camera for my remote job,
review.name: Great sweater if your belly is as flat as the model

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super soft, love the pattern and cut. Now the temps just need to cooperate so I can wear it!
review.name: Soft and cute

review.reviewBody: Another beautiful casual sweater that fills for in the hoodie/ sloppy sweatshirt with a more mature, polished look! Soft, warm and cozy material, great fit and styling!
review.name: Perfect casual alternative

review.reviewBody: I've never been much of a sweater girl, as I'm usually warm, but this one is perfect! It is unbelievably soft and the length is PERFECT with just the slightest crop. It is so difficult to find a sweater that hits at the bottom of the waist/top of the hip. The tiny holes in the pointelle stitch make it super breathable, so I don't feel overheated. Love, love, love!
review.name: I have three of these!

review.reviewBody: Great color, perfect size. I am 5'7" and 135 pounds. I ordered the medium, although I usually order a small because they didn't have a small in the color I wanted. It fits great and is very soft.
review.name: Great color, perfect size. I

review.reviewBody: The material is recycled nylon. It is a bit delicate. The first sweater I bought, the fabric was torn between the decorative holes. Customer service immediately replaced it!!! But I won’t be letting my dog play rough with me in this sweater…those claws will be trouble. It is SHORT. Very cropped. I thought about going up a size for length but the arms were below my wrists in a small and didn’t want to risk it.
review.name: Very Cute, Cropped Sweater

review.reviewBody: So soft and comfortable. It's thick and just right for cold days. It's intentionally boxy, and therefore pairs well with high rise pants. I bought the pale green, and I love it. I wouldn't mind if it was an inch or two longer. I have a long torso and with high rise jeans, if I lift my arms the sweater would rise above the top of my jeans. I wear an undershirt and that keeps my torso covered and warm. I'm 130 lbs, 5'5" thin/athletic build. I bought a small and it's just right.
review.name: Very soft, pretty color

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lovely sweater. I’m usually a small or medium but the small fits well.
review.name: Lovely sweater. I’m usually a

name: Monroe Sweater - Women's

review.reviewBody: This pack has a lot of good things going for it, but there are some significant design flaws that outweigh the good for me. This pack broke before I even got to use it. The buckle attachments that secure the brain/top lid both broke due to poor design and had to be secured with a knot. The first one broke at orientation for a Rainier climb, the second side broke during the climb. Additionally, when you use the top lid as a daypack, the attachment for the straps makes absolutely no sense and is poorly designed. Also had to secure these with a knot.
review.name: Great potential marred by design flaws

review.reviewBody: Everything expected! Great quality. Orange color is awesome!!!!! Grips are exactly that! Grippy and comfy for some shredding! Peddles are big and feel locked in!
review.name: Great as usual

review.reviewBody: Best composite pedal on the market for the price. Great grip, as good as my Chromags. Was looking for a cheap composite pedal, that I was going to put on my old bike. I ended putting them on the new bike because I liked them so much.
review.name: Grippy

review.reviewBody: I love the big platform, the grippy pins, and the colors pop. It's a huge value, but the performance is great. I have smallish feet and used to rock Chester pedals. I like these more and the big pedal has been great for practicing crankflips and foot offs.
review.name: 3rd pair says it all

review.reviewBody: I use these pedals for about 1 month they have great grip and a large platform. Ultimately I went back to my e13 alloy pedals which have better concavity and feel. Probably my only criticism of these pedals is that they tend to have a wide stance feel and that's okay for downhill riding but when doing trail riding and pedaling it can feel a little bit too wide. I like to have my feet a little closer when pedaling. But for their price they are excellent. I'd say they are more suited to gravity than trail riding.
review.name: Good if they work for you

review.reviewBody: They have loads of grip, are a awesome price, and you can't feel the spindle so they are comfy for long rides. The plate forms are large too. I got the first set for my mtb and now I need a second set for my bmx lol, I'm a heavy rider too and the plastic is very strong!
review.name: Awesome pedals

review.reviewBody: So far, the deftrap has left nothing to be desired. The pedals feel super balanced and grippy under my feet, and hold up to regular crashes quite well. Also style points come baked-in if you choose a fun colorway. Given that my personal bar for a great pair of pedals is not super high, these were exactly what I needed to inspire confidence on my rides.
review.name: Everything I want in a pedal

review.reviewBody:
Don't know if mine are defective but the grease out of one pedal keeps coming out. Hope it's not defective?!?!?

Other than that the fit and feel are great!
review.name: Great fit, comfortable, but messy?

review.reviewBody:
So far I am loving these! A couple rides on some particularly steep trails with zero concerns about slipping a pedal. Huge platforms (even with my size 13 five tens on them!), good spin, plenty of pins to keep you stuck to the pedals even with my beat up old shoes. 

My only complaint is the two little fixed plastic pins on each side of each pedal: already snapped off a couple of them despite no rock strikes. The metal ones more than make up for it but would be nice to be able to replace all the pins. They seem tough despite being light. 

UPDATE: took these down a particularly rocky trail and banged them several times against the rocks: pedals still look basically new. Metal pins are all holding up great, body looks practically unscathed, and I stayed on the pedals.
review.name: Solid new plastic pedal

name: Deftrap Pedals

review.reviewBody: Great fit. I’ve tried ExOfficio’s other styles. I like these because they hug your thighs so there’s not material bunching up when I pull my jeans on. The material is wicking which makes them comfortable to wear and quick to dry after washing. Great for traveling.

review.reviewBody: I found this brand in a random store in 2017 and bought 3 pair. All three of those are still going strong and are like new comfortable to this day. I bought another 3 pair from the website but they are not the same thing apparently. Less than 3 months in of regular use has worn holes in them. Do better exofficio.

review.reviewBody:
I am absolutely in LOVE with this bike! I bought it with the hopes of replacing all of my in town car trips with e-bike trips and so far it has been marvelous. I live downtown in my city and I find it easier and faster than taking a car most places because parking is much easier. I am currently in the process of ordering a lock from the Netherlands that is compatible with the integrated wheel lock for even easier parking. 

How's the ride? Marvelous! It has a very smooth, natural pedal assist to get you up to speed. It is so much better than some cheaper e-bikes I've demo that have a very jerky pedal assist. I couldn't say for sure if only having pedal assist as opposed to a combo of a throttle/pedal assist is my preference as this is my first e-bike and I certainly don't mind the light pedal required for the power to kick in. 

Security: I don't believe it's mentioned on the tech specs but the rear wheel has a built in rear lock. You can purchase a compatible chain lock from Axa that plugs in to the integrated lock for added security. I ended up purchasing mine on Amazon UK since they don't seem to be available in the US at the time of writing this review. 


Sizing: I am 5'6 with a long inseam for my height. I purchased the 53cm size and I have the seat almost as low as it can go and it is a great ride! I do think i could have gotten the 46cm but wanted to be able to share the bike with my partner who is 5'11 and on the end of the size chart for the 53cm.
review.name: Goodbye Gasoline

name: Ultimate C8 E-Bike

review.reviewBody: I really liked the fit. It runs small, but i'm on the small scale of Large. The garment seriously pills after 1 month. The areas that receive the most friction pill first, such as under each sleave and also for some reason the back is also pilling. The quality is very low and it will have to be thrown away soon. I typically usually like Marmot clothing, but items purchased in the past two years have been surprising low quality.

review.reviewBody: I like the style, colour and non slip sole. I think the bungee cord could be shorter.
review.name: Perfect fit

review.reviewBody: Straps to support foot were uncomfortable. I have an old pair of Keen's that I have worn for years. The straps are wider, made of leather, and comfortable. I found the new pair that I bought, which I have sent back, as too uncomfortable because of the lacings/ straps.
review.name: Straps to support foot were

review.reviewBody: Bought same size/ style as a pair I bought about 3 years ago. They're very uncomfortable and hurt my ankles. Unfortunately I wore them out of the house so I can't return them.
review.name: Ouch

review.reviewBody: Sandals look great and are so comfortable. Fits perfectly
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody:
Please keep making this tie dye version of the Whisper Sandal. So glad to see you still have them. Bought them right away so
I have a spare pair when my current ones break - probably several years from now. I’m an old Hippie and they are perfect for my vibe and so comfortable with great support! Was afraid you might be discontinuing this color so when you had a 10 in stock, I jumped at the chance to have a backup pair. I wear them every day - to work at the HBCU where I work in New Orleans and to all the concerts and festivals I attend! Keep them coming in tie dye! Normally a 9 or 9. 5 but a 10 in this shoe for the width. Keep making them in tie dye!!! Thanks a million! Ms. Polly in New Orleans
review.name: The perfect sandal for Dead and Company at Jazz Fest!

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair , for a reason! Long lasting, and good quality.
review.name: This is my second pair

review.reviewBody: Bought identical Keens in 2016. These new ones are most sturdy but not as flexible and harder to get your foot into. Also there is grooving etched into the footbed which is kind of annoying when you are barefoot. These are also wider on the sole, which I noticed as I bike a lot in these and they do not fit the same way as my old Keens do. Likely I will use these for walking and keep my old ones for biking. Would return them but I got them on sale.
review.name: Not the same as my old ones

review.reviewBody: use this for water workout. good quality and comfortable fit!
review.name: use this for water workout.

review.reviewBody: The most comfortable and versatile shoes I’ve ever owned. Have been wearing these almost daily for the past 10 months for walking, hiking, vacationing in Costa Rica, etc, and they’ve held up remarkably well. Easy to adjust to make looser or tighter as needed — I opted for 1/2 size up than I normally wear so I can use them with or without socks.
review.name: most comfortable & versatile shoes I’ve ever worn

review.reviewBody: Exceptionally comfortable, they don’t rub blisters, and I could walk all day in them.
review.name: Love these sandals!

review.reviewBody: The fabric feels more like polyester than merino wool. Otherwise it has a great fit and function as an under layer.
review.name: Not quite merino

review.reviewBody: This is the perfect baselayer under my cycling jacket on cold days! Wore it on a 40 degree morning and it krpt me very comfortable and warm
review.name: Love this hoodie

review.reviewBody: This hoodie makes for a great base while doing wildlife surveys either before sunrise or after sunset. Keeps you warm without needing to wear any bulky outer layers and is very comfortable. Material is stretchy and flexible but feels strong. I also didn't feel like I got too hot wearing it while hiking between survey locations. Haven't had the chance to test it in truly could weather yet, but seems like it would be a good base for that as well.
review.name: Extremely light but warm for late nights and early mornings

review.reviewBody: Great quality merino hoodie which doubles as a baclava...excellent for those sweet winter mountain days and everyday cold weather wear. A must have for outdoor layering arsenal.
review.name: Gnarly cold weather shirt

review.reviewBody: Warm, comfortable, not too Itchy. Doesn't smell after big days. Also love the hood, it fits great under helmet or hat in place of a buff or balaclava.
review.name: Solid Base layer.

review.reviewBody: I wore this as a baselayer against my skin this ski season. It's a wonderful design. I'd wear it with the hood and chin protector on chilly days under my helmet....loved it. I'm 5'9" and weigh 155 lbs. The size medium is perfect.
review.name: Quickly Becoming a Favorite Layer

review.reviewBody: The wool makes it a great base layer, but the integrated neck gaiter/hood is awesome. You can cover your face without the tightness of a balaclava, but the hood keeps it from falling down. It's great to keep the direct wind off your face and lets your breath keep your face warm, but also doesn't restrict your breathing, blow your exhaling into your eyes, or accumulate moisture like a tight balaclava. I freakin' love it.
review.name: Perfect underlayer, plus a clutch neck gaiter/hood.

review.reviewBody: Light material but still warm. Also, the face covering is perfect; it's not too tight against your face, but still blocks the wind enough to keep your cheeks warm. I wish they had more colors or patterns.
review.name: Warm and light.

review.reviewBody: I've used it several times ski touring in the wasatch in warmer conditions. Thumbholes and baklava/hood are great features and it breathes decently enough (for the heat I used it in). Cannot say how it holds up on a cold day but no complaints so far. I will say it is a little rougher than one would hope for a base layer, I got a little chafing on my chest with it but I wear bibs touring so your mileage may vary. The fabric overall should be softer at this pricepoint imo. At my height/weight it is just on the edge of being too short but still fits fine. Size: M Measurements: 6ft 175
review.name: Good Ski Touring Layer

review.reviewBody: I love having an extra warm layer to use on cold days! Having it come over my forehead and up over my chin is very nice and makes a big difference to help me get out on colder days. It is a little scratchier than I was hoping - did not bug me once running but will likely use it as a second layer.
review.name: Life saver for running in the cold!

review.reviewBody: I’ve used both adjustable and non-adjustable versions now. The flexibility is nice depending on if you are using the poles for shelter setups or need to lend them to someone. Quality is rock solid. They just work!
review.name: Light, Fast, and Adjustable.

review.reviewBody: I bought my first Distance Carbon FLZs way back when Black Diamond first offered them. I used them in all kinds of desert hikes, big mountain summits (Mount Whitney, Grand Teton, Granite Peak in Montana, Gannett Peak, etc,), all hard going and a LOT of pole abuse. My second pair ditto. Then two days ago I came hustling down 2,000 feet from a peak in Oregon, in brush, scree, and snow, and one pole broke internally and came apart. Can you understand my anger when I only got 11 YEARS out of those crappy poles?? [Just kidding, of course. ] I have other Black Diamond poles for snow, etc. , and I don't look anywhere else for top hiking/climbing gear.
review.name: Best Ever

review.reviewBody: Got these poles for myself for hiking in Alaska and peakbagging. Getting a lightweight pole that packs down and carries easily is often for me the difference between bringing them or not. These poles adjust easily on the fly and pack down perfectly. Grip is comfortable and the pile is sturdy and supportive.
review.name: Best tool for the job!

review.reviewBody: Love these poles. The flickLock is super cool. It pops open and closes nice and tight. Very easy to adjust the length on the go. I also like the locking mechanism used to straighten the pole. It's bigger than older models. Glad I got a pair of these. Also it's super easy to remove the hand straps if you prefer to go strapless.
review.name: Super Light & adjustable!

review.reviewBody: Light and compact. They break down smaller than my old pair. I’m a bit concerned they don’t have cork grips—we will see in the summer time how that feels.
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: I have two sets of these poles one for my husband one for me. Both have failed because the little metal lock breaks. I can replace under warranty. I am very wary of going anywhere with these poles for fear that the same failure will occur . Is there a newer stronger locking mechanism on new poles ? Is there a substitute pole with something less fragile ?
review.name: Lock mechanism failure twice

review.reviewBody: These poles are very sturdy and extremely light weight. Very easy to assemble and break down while on the move.
review.name: High Quality / Low Weight

review.reviewBody: I wrote you about a week ago about the defective hiking poles and I have not heard back from you. The hand straps have no Velcro, rendering the polls useless. Should I return them? Or do you have a good set of straps you could send to me? I would take them in large. I will send my Request again to your Service email because it could be that no one reads this.
review.name: Defective

review.reviewBody: I bought these a month ago and used them on hikes in Yosemite.  I am disappointed that the two lengths do not overlap.  110 is perfect for my level hiking and I can make them longer for downhill.  Going uphill I would prefer the poles to be shorter, and this adjustment cannot be made.  With the current lengths, I can have 110 or less, or 110 and more but not both.
review.name: Light sturdy poles

review.reviewBody: Why do I say this? 1- Carbon FLZ is versitile for me. 2- Ultra lite. 3- 100cm-125 length = skiing length+20 extension for hiking ‘up’ easier. 4- Overcenter lever is minimal and ‘near the top’ of the pole and unlikely to lose poles skiing the trees. 5- Carbon fiber is lite, strong, stiff ..and spendy. Worth it. 6- Compact ..if I need it ..quickly. 7- Resort skiing, AT skiing, backcountry skiing, trail running FLZ poles work perfectly. Good job BD team!!
review.name: All year ski poles for me

name: Distance Carbon FLZ Trekking Poles

hasVariant.description: Buy the Helly Hansen Lifaloft Hooded Insulator Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I got the purple (amethyst) and it's gorgeous in person. The material is nice, soft, swishy but not obnoxiously so, and definitely warm for the weight. However, it wouldn't work by itself for freezing temperatures -- it's more for cool/cold-but-not-frigid weather. The stair-step stitching is nice and different from a lot of insulated jackets. This is nice to wear just as street outerwear -- I haven't tried it yet hiking or backpacking, mainly because I like it too much to get it dirty!
review.name: This is my new favorite jacket

review.reviewBody: I bought this as a midlayer for backcountry skiing or hiking, and an outer layer for mountain running overnight in ultras. It's just okay. Fundamental problem: the jacket is marketed as having some of the most highly packable insulation. Except it doesn't have a stuff sack and doesn't pack into it's own pocket. Not sure why HH takes pride in packability and then doesn't offer an option for packing. Second, the jacket is a bit short. It's fine under a shell, but as an outer layer, it's over my belly when I lift my hands. I'm 5'5", so not particularly tall. And third, it's not that warm - more like a heavy flannel than an insulated jacket. I found it too light to wear on descents skiing. The fabric feels nice, and the interior stuff pockets are nice. But I am now wearing this as a casual wear piece - outer layer if it's in the upper 40s, or mid layer walking around town in single digits. If you're looking for something that is warm AND functional for sports, this isn't it. But if you just want a cute, lightweight jacket, and you aren't too long-waisted, this is fine.
review.name: Okay - depending on what you want it for

name: Lifaloft Hooded Insulator Jacket - Women's

hasVariant.name: Serpico 2 Polarized Sunglasses
hasVariant.description: Buy the Smith Serpico 2 Polarized Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Love these shades! Excellent coverage without looking like ive got my snow goggles on. The Green Chromapop lens work well in everything from overcast skies to severe clear full sun. Great clarity with enhanced color to boot. Definitely highly recommend these to those looking for an Aviator with a twist. Light weight and very comfortable for extended periods of time.
review.name: All around fantastic sunglasses.

review.reviewBody:
I bought my first pair of Serpico's (1st gen) in 2009 and currently I'm on my fourth pair. My wife liked mine so much that she bought a pair too. The polarized and chroma-pop optical quality is excellentt, the toric lens curvature is beyond reproach, the novel nose-piece design is tops. I think these are the most finely styled aviators on the market. Ever better than my WWII pilot grandfathers mil-issued Ray Bans! 

But, the ear piece, temple piece... hinge interface is poorly designed. Hence why I'm on my fourth pair in 14 years. They eventually wear out or just break, I know this four times first hand. I've been round and round with Smith CS many times regarding this and I assure you I take very good care of my glasses. If they aren't on my face they're in their case. 

So goodby Smith Serpico's, I'm done. I'll dearly miss the Serpico's but these glasses deserve a redesigned (better) frame that that will hold up better to being worn daily. Spring temples anyone? I'll keep watch for Serpico III's. Until then I'm going to try some competitors wares.
review.name: Great Glasses with a glaring weakness

name: Serpico 2 Polarized Sunglasses

review.reviewBody: I’m not someone who typically reviews products but these blew me away. After trying on 15+ snow pants, I ordered these pants and crossed my fingers. Not only did they actually fit true to size (which ski clothes never seem to do) but they were SO CUTE! I was the cutest I’d ever been on the slopes and the color was surprisingly easy to match with other gear.
review.name: True to size

review.reviewBody: Fits perfectly. I own two and want more colors!!!!
review.name: My favorite bib!!

review.reviewBody: This bib is comfortable and stylish. I like the generous pockets and adjustable waistband. Fit seems true to size - I sized up to Large ensure a roomy fit but I think Medium would work as well.
review.name: Cute Bib

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits true to size and I like that you can snap the waist band into place! I ordered a tall size and it is still a bit short than I would like but other than that it’s perfect!
review.name: Love the quality!

review.reviewBody: Color is so cute and the fit is perfect. Size down if you want a more fitted look.
review.name: So flattering

review.reviewBody: I love the Carson Bib pant so much! They kept me so warm on my most recent ski trip but yet they’re not super bulky like other bibs! Functional but fashionable :)
review.name: The best bib pant!!

review.reviewBody: I love this bib, fits perfect and keeps me nice and dry. Cheaper than other stores I looked at!
review.name: Great price compared to other sellers!

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a pair of ski bibs to keep me extra warm on the mountain. These definitely kept me warm on my ski trip to the White Mountains. Love the adjustable fit.
review.name: My favorite ski pants!

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and cute snow bib!  Didn’t think those two things could go together in a sentence.  I’m in the middle of both the XL and 1X size guidelines for the brand.  The XL was skin tight.  Looked amazing but no way I could ski without the ability or freedom to layer underneath for cold weather so sized up to 1X.  It’s very loose but don’t mind.  First time as a plus size woman to have a snow pant that doesn’t feel tight and restrictive.  So grateful for the extended sizing in this brand!  I’m usually a 16 or a 14w in clothing in pants.  Gorgeous and unique color!  So noticeable on mountain for my kids to find me.
review.name: Plus size women and pear shapes rejoice

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am so happy with these bibs! In pairing with the jacket, I was so incredibly comfortable throughout all types of ski climates. These bibs have so many great features like adjustable straps, high quality zippers, amazing pocket placement, zipper openings at the ankle, moisture wicking, and so much more. I am so happy with these bibs!
review.name: Amazing Quality

name: Carson Bib Pant - Women's
